outcome_details: Mistrial granted on two counts of previous guilty verdict due to Crown's disclosure breach

remedy.terms: A mistrial declared with future consideration on its scope regarding Count 3

decision_factors: Improper Crown disclosure of T.W.S. statement
Capacity to make full answer and defence was impeded
summary: Mr. Birtch was granted a mistrial on two counts of a previous guilty verdict due to inadequate Crown disclosure efforts, which breached his s. 7 Charter rights. The trial judge decided that meaningful redress required a mistrial, given that the non-disclosure interfered with the ability to make full answer and defence. Further submissions are invited regarding the possible application of the mistrial ruling to Count 3.
